1096000389458071553.text:
The Monero and Zcash communities should talk to each other more.

For example, Monero's "burning bug" (https://www.getmonero.org/2018/09/25/a-post-mortum-of-the-burning-bug.html …) was known as "faerie gold vulnerability" in Zerocash at least 3 years earlier (https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/98 …), and fixed before Zcash went live.

1014921157139558400.text:
Being a PhD student is a job.

The student becomes an apprentice for 3-6 years, and learns by doing research. 

The student is paid a stipend in exchange for doing research. 

This is different from a BS or a MS degree, where the student pays tuition fees to the university.https://twitter.com/Mantia/status/1013559718759956481 …

1101241316007063552.text: Many optimizations since I gave a talk on this at Scaling Bitcoin

1101241113262776321.text: New paper with Lucianna Kiffer (joint first author), @loi_luu, @mahdi_zamani_ on Flyclient. Super light clients for PoW chains. You only need to download O(log(n)) block headers. We prove that our scheme is “optimal”. For Ethereum 3.6GB-> 500kb. https://eprint.iacr.org/2019/226

1100421602800414720.text: Many applications: Sealed bid auctions, confidential payment channels, stake voting (for small groups) and privacy preserving proof of stake. We also have an extension to Zether which adds some Monero style anonymity (Full anonymity is hard in account systems).

1100420033925177345.text: Our new paper is finally on Eprint. We construct a confidential payment system on top of Ethereum. It works with Ethereum today and is compatible with other smart contracts. The techniques apply to account based payments in general. Also: extension to BP called Sigma-Bulletshttps://twitter.com/IACRePrint/status/1100237241157369856 …

What is a SNARK?
n=size of the statement
I have seen
o(n) proof size
log(n) proof size
O(1) proof size
Same as above but proof size + verification time
Any of the above but with trusted setup
A pairing based protocol akin to GGPR based on knowledge assumptions
a fictional animal

1001574545034113024.text: BLS and blockchains seem to be a perfect match:   1st: N signers of 1 transaction= 1 signature, 1 pk and ex post aggregation! 2nd N signers N transactions= N pks and 1 signature. 3rd N pks subset signs= Description of subset + 1 sig +1 pk https://eprint.iacr.org/2018/483.pdf
